item.title: About
item.author: youremail@domain.com (Some Person)
item.description: Hello! I am a PhD Student at The University of Edinburgh working in the Computational Cognitive Science Lab with Neil Bramley and Chris Lucas. I am broadly interested in building human-like intelligent machines and multi-agent systems for collective problem solving. My current research mainly focuses on how agents learn and adapt probabilistic programs in a challenging game of inductive logic (Demo). Additionally, I work on probabilistic and causal reasoning in multi-agent reasoning tasks (Demo).
